Title: Direct projections from the ventral TE area of the inferotemporal cortex to the hippocampal field CA1 in the monkey
Abstract: Anterogradely labeled terminals were found densely in field CA1, but not in any other field, of the hippocampal formation following injections of horseradish peroxidase into the ventral TE area of the inferotemporal cortex, whereas no label was seen in any field of the hippocampal formation following injections into the dorsal TE area. The labeled terminals were distributed mainly in a medial part of the stratum moleculare of field CA1 throughout its rostrocaudal extent. The present finding provides the first demonstration of direct projections from the inferotemporal cortex to the hippocampal formation.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation: "The delineations of cortical arae TE and the hippocampal formation were the same as were described in our previous study [7]. Area TE and its surrounding areas of TEO, TF, TH, TG and 35 (perirhinal ) were delineated on the cytoarchitectonic parcellations of von Bonin and Bailey [15] and Brodmann [1]. In this study, area TE was divided ointo the dorsal and ventral TE fields (TEd and TEv, respectively), because Brodmann [1] subdivided the inferotemporal cortex cytoarchitectonically into areas 20 and 21, which correspond to fields TEv and TEd, respectively. In fact, these two fields are different from each other in their connectivities with the amygdala [8]. The border between them was established as the anterior middle temporal sulcus and its caudal extension toward the gaze point in area V1. The delineations of the hippocampal formation were based on the descriptions of Lorente de Nò [9] and Van Hoesen and Pandya [14]. The hippocampal formation included 7 fields of the dentate gyrus, fields CA1-4, the prosubiculum and subiculum. Lorente de Nó [9] has subdivided field CA1 into 3 subfields named CA1a, CA1b, and CA1c. We adopted this classification to refer to the portion of label. Although Nissl-stained material do not clarify the borders between subfields CA1a, CA1b and CA1c, these subfields were defined as the medial, middle and lateral one-third of field CA1, respectively. The border between subfield CA1a and the prosubiculum was defined by the appearance of polymorph layer in the prosubiculum [9]." (p. 7)
@BrainMaps_Delineation.Comments:
There were no abbreviations for their own defined subfields of CA1, which should correspond to those subfields of CA1(CA1a-c) defined by Lorente de Nò ('34).
Therefore, we called the medial one-third field of CA1 area       CA1-med, the middle one-third field of CA1 area CA1-mid, and the lateral one-third of CA1 area CA1-lat.

In this study, area TE was divided ointo the dorsal and ventral TE fields (TEd and TEv, respectively), because Brodmann [1] subdivided the inferotemporal cortex cytoarchitectonically into areas 20 and 21, which correspond to fields TEv and TEd, respectively. In fact, these two fields are different from each other in their connectivities with the amygdala [8]. The border between them was established as the anterior middle temporal sulcus and its caudal extension toward the gaze point in area V1. The delineations of the hippocampal formation were based on the descriptions of Lorente de Nò [9] and Van Hoesen and Pandya [14]. @InterMapRelations_clean.Citation: "The delineations of cortical arae TE and the hippocampal formation were the same as were described in our previous study [7]. Area TE and its surrounding areas of TEO, TF, TH, TG and 35 (perirhinal ) were delineated on the cytoarchitectonic parcellations of von Bonin and Bailey [15] and Brodmann [1]. In this study, area TE was divided ointo the dorsal and ventral TE fields (TEd and TEv, respectively), because Brodmann [1] subdivided the inferotemporal cortex cytoarchitectonically into areas 20 and 21, which correspond to fields TEv and TEd, respectively. In fact, these two fields are different from each other in their connectivities with the amygdala [8]. The border between them was established as the anterior middle temporal sulcus and its caudal extension toward the gaze point in area V1. The delineations of the hippocampal formation were based on the descriptions of Lorente de Nò [9] and Van Hoesen and Pandya [14]. The hippocampal formation included 7 fields of the dentate gyrus, fields CA1-4, the prosubiculum and subiculum. Lorente de Nó [9] has subdivided field CA1 into 3 subfields named CA1a, CA1b, and CA1c. We adopted this classification to refer to the portion of label. Although Nissl-stained material do not clarify the borders between subfields CA1a, CA1b and CA1c, these subfields were defined as the medial, middle and lateral one-third of field CA1, respectively. The border between subfield CA1a and the prosubiculum was defined by the appearance of polymorph layer in the prosubiculum [9]." (p. 7)

@Injections.Citation:
"The HRP injection sites in the 7 cases are indicated in Fig. 1A. In all cases, the needle tracks for the injections remained within the gray matter. Each injection site was well localized within either the TEd or TEv field; no diffusion into neighboring areas of 35 (perirhinal), TEO, TF, TH and TG was seen in any case.
In all cases with field TEv injections (cases 1-4), whether of WGA-HRP or free HRP, anterograde label was found in hippocampal field CA1 ipsilateral to the injections, but no label  was encountered in any other field or in the contralateral hippocampal formation." (p. 7)
"The label in cases with injections into the anterior TEv field (cases 1 and 2) was heavier and more extensive than that in cases with the posterior TEv injections (cases 3 and 4)." (p. 7)
"In cases with TEd injections (cases 5-7), neither anterograde nor retrograde label was found in any field of the hippocampal formation." (p. 8)

"The HRP injection sites in the 7 cases are indicated in Fig. 1A. In all cases, the needle tracks for the injections remained within the gray matter. Each injection site was well localized within either the TEd or TEv field; no diffusion into neighboring areas of 35 (perirhinal), TEO, TF, TH and TG was seen in any case.
In all cases with field TEv injections (cases 1-4), whether of WGA-HRP or free HRP, anterograde label was found in hippocampal field CA1 ipsilateral to the injections, but no label  was encountered in any other field or in the contralateral hippocampal formation." (p. 7)
"The label in cases with injections into the anterior TEv field (cases 1 and 2) was heavier and more extensive than that in cases with the posterior TEv injections (cases 3 and 4)." (p. 7)

"The HRP injection sites in the 7 cases are indicated in Fig. 1A. In all cases, the needle tracks for the injections remained within the gray matter. Each injection site was well localized within either the TEd or TEv field; no diffusion into neighboring areas of 35 (perirhinal), TEO, TF, TH and TG was seen in any case.
In all cases with field TEv injections (cases 1-4), whether of WGA-HRP or free HRP, anterograde label was found in hippocampal field CA1 ipsilateral to the injections, but no label  was encountered in any other field or in the contralateral hippocampal formation." (p. 7)
"The label in cases with injections into the anterior TEv field (cases 1 and 2) was heavier and more extensive than that in cases with the posterior TEv injections (cases 3 and 4)." (p. 7)

publication.title: Direct projections from the ventral TE area of the inferotemporal cortex to the hippocampal field CA1 in the monkey
publication.abstract: Anterogradely labeled terminals were found densely in field CA1, but not in any other field, of the hippocampal formation following injections of horseradish peroxidase into the ventral TE area of the inferotemporal cortex, whereas no label was seen in any field of the hippocampal formation following injections into the dorsal TE area. The labeled terminals were distributed mainly in a medial part of the stratum moleculare of field CA1 throughout its rostrocaudal extent. The present finding provides the first demonstration of direct projections from the inferotemporal cortex to the hippocampal formation.
